alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Crook (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 2:17PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Crook County through 245 PM MDT... At 216 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Vore Buffalo Jump, or 14 miles northeast of Sundance, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea to penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Aladdin around 230 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Bear Lodge Campground. This includes Interstate 90 in Wyoming between Mile Markers 198 and 206. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm is producing large quantities of hail. Driving through deep hail is like driving on slushy roads. Slow down and do not brake suddenly.
